subject: Sexual Health
title: First Crushes and Attraction
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on First Crushes and Attraction.

hook.text: The first crush can feel all-consuming because puberty literally rewires the brain's reward system for romance.

buildup.text: Rising sex hormones activate interest in romantic and sexual attraction for the first time.

discovery.text: Dopamine floods the brain during crushes, creating intense focus, excitement, and longing similar to addiction.

twist.text: These first feelings of attraction are a normal developmental milestone, regardless of the gender of the crush.

climax.text: Early romantic experiences help teens learn about boundaries, communication, and emotional vulnerability.

punchline.text: First crushes are brain chemistry class in disguise.

quiz.question: What neurotransmitter creates the intense feelings during a crush?
